<<Which, anybody that has suggestions for books to read that deal with these
ideas or
particularly the Shimabara Rebellion, I'd love your suggestions.>>

 I good book to start with his George Elison's Dues Destroyed. It describes
how christianity was "translated" in Japan; how Christian concepts were
interpreted in a "Buddhist" fashion.

As for the Shimabara rebellion, the most detailed work in English may be in
Ivan Morris's Nobility of Failure.
